[SYNTAX]: Awkward phrasing in "to the authority that appealed to my fancy, and to a new loyalty, I was a willing slave" (comma splice/misplaced conjunction).
Run-on sentence starting with "Thus we are led up to the statement..." (excessively long, lacks clarity).
[GRAMMAR]: Tense inconsistency in "Before the time of apprenticeship had expired Reynolds had quarrelled..." (unnecessary past perfect).
[STRUCTURE]: Abrupt transition in "the reign of Queen Victoria... covered the latter half of this saeculum mirabile..." (unclear connection).

[LOGIC]: Sudden shift from Reynolds' biography to Bahá’u’lláh and Boucher without contextual linkage.
Disconnected segments discussing unrelated figures/events (e.g., French Revolution vs. Reynolds' apprenticeship).
[TRANSITION]: Abrupt jumps between topics (e.g., Industrial Revolution to Reynolds' life to Spencer's philosophy).
[CLARITY]: Unclear references to "the Bábí community" and "Commodore Keppel" without contextual explanation.
[STRUCTURE]: Non-linear narrative mixing personal anecdotes, historical events, and philosophical analysis without clear progression.

[SYNTAX]: Overly complex sentence structures with excessive subclauses that hinder readability.
[LEXICON]: Use of obscure philosophical terminology ("obverse or objective aspect," "concomitant evolution") that may confuse readers.
[PUNCTUATION]: Misuse of semicolons and lack of proper breaks in long sentences.
[CLARITY]: Redundant phrasing ("It is true that... It is true that...") and wordy expressions.
[TRANSITION]: Abrupt shifts between abstract concepts without clear signposting.

[LOGIC]: Sudden leap from discussing Spencer's philosophy to the "Unknowable" without clear logical scaffolding.
[STRUCTURE]: Disjointed flow between biological evolution and mental evolution explanations.
[CLARITY]: Ambiguous connections between "oscillations of molecules" and "units of consciousness."
[TRANSITION]: Unclear linkage between the concluding quote and the preceding argumentation.
[CONCEPTUAL]: Confusing treatment of subject/object duality and its resolution through the "Ultimate Reality."
